description: WASHINGTON — The U.S. Capitol Police said Friday that they had arrested a man who was trying to enter the building with a hammer.
title: Capitol Police arrest man trying to enter the building with a hammer

description: The Department of Labor seeks to prevent a Tosk Pork in Tennessee from retaliating against employees after a severed pig’s head was allegedly left at a workstation, according to a complaint.
title: Tennessee farm worker finds severed pig's head at workstation after asking about pay, complaint states

description: A Colorado Bureau of Investigation DNA analyst intentionally manipulated data in the testing process for at least 15 years, according to an internal affairs investigation.
title: Investigation finds Colorado DNA analyst intentionally manipulated data

description: One of the big sources of uncertainty about the 2024 race: How many third-party candidates will there be, and where will they be on the ballot.
title: Why the third-party role in 2024 is so unpredictable: From the Politics Desk

description: An oil spill appeared off the Southern California coast Thursday night, near one of the region's most popular beaches, authorities said.
title: Apparent oil spill seen off popular Southern California coastline, authorities said

description: A Democrat running to represent Uvalde, Texas, in Congress blasted the latest report into the 2022 school shooting.
title: Democrat running for Uvalde House seat blasts report on school shooting

description: President Joe Biden said Friday that he would sign a bill that could ban TikTok in the U.S. unless its China-based owner ByteDance divests the app.
title: President Biden supports bill that could make TikTok unavailable in the U.S.

description: A Trump supporter is now charged with firing a gun outside the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021. The first rioter to be charged with firing a weapon.
title: Trump supporter charged with firing a gun during the Jan. 6 Capitol attack

description: Two former Texas sheriff’s deputies were acquitted of all charges in the death of a Black man who was tased several times following a police chase that was captured on the reality television show "Live PD."
title: 2 former Texas deputies acquitted in death of man who was tased following police chase

description: Temple University said it was looking into reports of match fixing of a Division 1 men's basketball game.
title: Temple University reviewing reports of potential match-fixing of men's basketball game

description: Oceanside police have confirmed the recent sightings of a mountain lion prowling the streets of Oceanside this week.
title: Mountain lion spotted on camera roaming through the streets of a California coastal city

description: The blockbuster weight loss drug Wegovy is now approved by the FDA to reduce heart disease risk, drugmaker Novo Nordisk said Friday.
title: FDA approves Wegovy to reduce heart attack and stroke risk

description: With spring approaching, dermatologists are spreading awareness of a lesser-known skin condition associated with sun exposure.
title: Doctors call attention to 'margarita rashes' from sun exposure as spring approaches

description: The brother of Indiana mom Stefanie Smith, who died last week while flying home from vacation in the Dominican Republic, said Friday that they still don’t know what killed her. “I’d say the uncertainty, the not knowing how she died, the not knowing when her body will be returned to us, has been the hardest thing recently,” Chris Volz told NBC News.
title: Family of an Indiana mom who died on a plane are still dealing with 'uncertainty'

description: The Senate inched Friday toward a vote to prevent a government shutdown but the possibility of a brief shutdown lingers.
title: Senate inches toward a vote on government funding bill amid fears of brief shutdown

description: New police body camera video shows the aftermath of a crash involving Miami Heat forward Haywood Highsmith that cost a 21-year-old man part of his leg. The crash happened on Feb.
title: Video shows aftermath of crash involving Miami Heat’s Haywood Highsmith, man who lost part of leg

description: Chicago authorities have identified two cases of measles as of Friday, one city resident and a migrant child at a shelter, the first cases reported in Chicago since 2019.
title: Chicago confirms two cases of measles after city resident and migrant child diagnosed

description: Halle Bailey had a very strong reason for keeping her pregnancy to herself.
title: 'Little Mermaid' star Halle Bailey reveals why she kept her pregnancy a secret

description: Republican Rep. Matt Rosendale won't run for re-election to the House after ending his bid for Montana Senate, citing rumors and a death threat.
title: GOP Rep. Matt Rosendale drops re-election bid in Montana

description: No Labels delegates voted Friday to continue the process of forming a presidential ticket. But it's still unclear exactly when, or if, that will happen.
title: No Labels delegates vote to continue pursuing a third-party presidential ticket

description: In unanimous votes, RNC members elected Donald Trump’s hand-picked leadership team to head up the national party during spring meetings.
title: Trump officially takes over the Republican National Committee

description: In the new film “Kung Fu Panda 4,” comedian Ronny Chieng, much like his castmates, doesn’t voice anyone who remotely resembles himself.
title: Ronny Chieng thinks representation still matters when it comes to animated films

description: The semi-annual shopping event is happening right now, and you can save on skin care, beauty, and makeup during the 20-day sale. New products from brands like Olaplex and First Aid Beauty will rotate daily and are up to 50% off.
title: The big Ulta beauty sale is happening now

description: Rupert Murdoch, 92, got engaged to his girlfriend, Elena Zhukova, a spokesman said on Thursday, which would mark his fifth trip down the aisle.
title: Rupert Murdoch, 92, is engaged for the sixth time

description: A United Airlines flight rolled off the runway at a Houston airport Friday morning, the airline said in a statement.
title: United Airlines flight rolls off runway at Houston airport

description: Iowa state House Republicans passed a personhood bill that puts the state directly into the national battle over protections for IVF.
title: Iowa Republicans pass personhood bill that critics say could threaten IVF care

description: Friday night into Saturday morning is shaping up to be a dangerous period with severe thunderstorms charging across some parts of South and Gulf Coast states while flash flooding threatens other parts of the Southeast states.
title: South braces for significant flood threat and severe storms this weekend

description: Powerful 40 mph winds from Feb. 29 to March 2 in Death Valley blew Lake Manly two miles north, according to the National Park Service.
title: Strong winds blew a lake 2 miles north in Death Valley National Park

description: Oscar-winning actor Natalie Portman and Benjamin Millepied, a French dancer and choreographer, officially divorced last month.
title: Natalie Portman and Benjamin Millepied divorce after 11 years of marriage

description: The younger brother of Super Bowl-winning Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes has been sentenced to six months’ probation in a case alleging an assault on a woman.
title: Patrick Mahomes' younger brother sentenced in case stemming from alleged assault of woman

description: Lance Ligocki was arrested on Jan. 6 charges Thursday, in a case that again underlines the pro-Trump motivations of the mob that stormed the Capitol.
title: Jan. 6 rioter holding 'stop the steal' sign swung at officers with a Trump flag, FBI says

description: Attorneys for former President Donald Trump filed official notice Friday they're appealing the $83 million defamation verdict awarded to writer E. Jean Carroll — and that they've posted the $91 million bond needed to keep her from collecting while the appeal plays out.
title: Trump posts $91 million bond and files notice to appeal in E. Jean Carroll case

description: A former convict who became a criminal justice reform advocate was arrested on several charges including murder after police found a human torso in a Bronx apartment while conducting a welfare check.
title: Criminal justice advocate arrested after human torso is found in NYC apartment

description: At least "some" football fans, who attended January's bitterly cold Kansas City Chiefs playoff game, suffered extreme frostbite and eventually needed amputations, a hospital official said Thursday.
title: Some attendees of frigid Chiefs game forced into amputations following severe frostbite, Kansas City hospital says

description: Much of the Great Lakes region — known for frigid winter temperatures, icy lakes and snow-covered forests — has looked bare almost all winter.
title: A lack of ice is reshaping winter life around the Great Lakes

description: 'Traitors' season 2 finale and reunion: Everything that went down
title: 'Traitors' Season 2 finale and reunion: Everything that went down

description: The FBI arrested the founder of a Washington, D.C., nonprofit that served homeless LGBTQ youth on money laundering and fraud charges after her return to the United States from El Salvador.
title: Founder of D.C. LGBTQ nonprofit arrested on fraud and money laundering charges

description: CONCORD, N.H. — The estranged wife of a New Hampshire man convicted of killing his 5-year-old daughter and moving the body around for months was granted parole on Thursday, more than a year after she was sentenced to prison for lying about where she was when the child was last seen.
title: Stepmother of slain 5-year-old Harmony Montgomery granted parole for perjury

description: As SAT season kicks off this weekend, students across the U.S. for the first time will take it with computers and tablets — and not the pencils they’ve used since the college admissions test was introduced nearly a century ago.
title: SAT will be taken entirely online for the first time in the U.S. this weekend

description: Danai Deligeorges and Alexia Beziki became one of the first gay couples in Greece to get married after parliament passed a bill last month allowing same-sex couples to wed.
title: ‘Love wins’ say Greek lesbian couple as they wed at last

description: A majority of Asian Americans living in New York City have altered aspects of their lives to prevent being the target of an anti-Asian incident, according to a new study released Thursday.
title: Most Asian Americans in NYC adopted different behaviors out of fear of anti-Asian hate, new study shows

description: Christine Brown is sharing a fond memory of Garrison Brown following the 25-year-old’s death earlier this week.
title: 'Sister Wives' star Christine Brown reflects on the death of Janelle Brown’s son in heartfelt tribute

description: Two men have been arrested for allegedly causing the deaths of a 7-year-old boy and his aunt when the boat their group had chartered for a Hudson River tour capsized in 2022, throwing more than a dozen people overboard, federal prosecutors announced Thursday.
title: 2 charged in Hudson River capsize deaths of woman, 7-year-old nephew

description: Three inmates who escaped prison in Grenada last month have been charged with capital murder in the deaths of an American couple presumed dead after their yacht was hijacked.
title: Prison escapees charged with murder in deaths of American couple presumed dead after yacht hijack

description: Venezuela announced it would hold presidential elections on July 28 but has banned Pres. Nicolás Maduro's strongest challenger, María Corina Machado and other contenders lack the machinery to run against him.
title: Venezuela sidelines any opponents of Maduro as it announces election date

description: Colombian reggaetón superstar Karol G made history at Billboard Women in Music awards ceremony, winning Woman of the Year.
title: Karol G makes history as first Latina named woman of the year at Billboard ceremony

description: Some parents at Pioneer Technology and Arts Academy are expressing outrage at disciplinary action handed down to a handful of students over how they reacted upon learning their classmate showed up to school armed with a gun.
title: Texas students suspended for not reporting classmate with gun, parents outraged

description: The U.S. military said Friday that despite a series of fatal crashes it deemed the V-22 Osprey aircraft safe to fly and has lifted its grounding order.
title: Military clears Ospreys to fly again after a series of fatal crashes

description: France inscribed the guaranteed right to abortion in its constitution Friday, a powerful message of support for women’s rights on International Women’s Day.
title: France inscribes the right to abortion in its constitution as world marks International Women’s Day

description: Gunmen attacked a school in Nigeria’s northwest region Thursday and abducted at least 287 students, the headteacher told authorities, marking the second mass abduction in the West African nation in less than a week.
title: Gunmen abduct 287 students in the latest school attack in Nigeria’s northwest

description: State of the Union, Marjorie Taylor Greene, Laken Riley, Katie Britt, jobs numbers, Michigan shooter, James Crumbley, Texas wildfire, TikTok ban, George Santos
title: Biden's State of the Union and bill threatening to ban TikTok advances: Morning Rundown

description: Former campers at Trails Carolina, a North Carolina wilderness program for troubled youth where a boy died last month, recall fear and humiliation.
title: ‘Where the hell am I?’: Former campers describe harsh introduction to Trails Carolina

description: At least a dozen major recalls have been announced in the last six weeks.
title: Recalls have been issued for frozen dumplings, eye ointment, gun safes and more — see the latest list

description: The Food and Drug Administration has pushed back its approval decision deadline for Eli Lilly’s experimental Alzheimer’s drug donanemab.
title: In an unusual move, FDA postpones approval decision for Lilly’s Alzheimer’s drug

description: Fire season in Alberta, Canada, typically begins March 1.
title: Wildfire seasons are starting earlier and getting longer

description: As fentanyl scanning equipment intended for the border sits unused, Montana Sen. Jon Tester is blaming Republicans and asking Congress to approve funds for installation.
title: Sen. Tester asks Congress to fund installation of border fentanyl scanners that now sit idle

description: U.S. citizens in Moscow have been told to avoid large gatherings on Friday and Saturday because of fears of an imminent terrorist attack in the Russian capital.
title: U.S. warns of imminent Moscow attack by 'extremists,' urges citizens to avoid crowds

description: TOKYO — Akira Toriyama, one of the most influential and best-selling manga authors of all time, has died, his studio said Friday.
title: ‘Dragon Ball’ creator Akira Toriyama dies at 68

description: Three people were shot Thursday afternoon in a park in Salem, Oregon, and one of them has died, police said.
title: Shooting at park in Salem, Oregon, kills 1 person and wounds 2 others

description: Ten years after its disappearance, the Malaysian government and a U.S. technology firm are considering a new search for Malaysia Airlines Flight 370.
title: 10 years after a Malaysia Airlines plane vanished, can it still be found?

description: Steve Lawrence, a singer and top stage act who as a solo performer and in tandem with his wife Eydie Gorme kept Tin Pan Alley alive during the rock era, died Thursday.
title: Steve Lawrence, singer and half of stage duo Steve & Eydie, dies at 88

description: The message that Joe Biden most needed to deliver Thursday night wasn't so much that the American union is strong, but that the American president is fit.
title: Biden stares down questions about his age and fitness for office with spirited speech

description: Former Rep. George Santos announced Thursday night that he will run for New York's 1st Congressional District, challenging a Republican who voted to expel him from Congress.
title: Former Rep. George Santos announces run for Congress

description: Watch key moments from President Biden's 2024 State of the Union address. The president discussed issues facing the nation at home and abroad, from the Israel-Hamas conflict to reproductive rights.
title: Watch President Biden's State of the Union address in under 4 minutes

description: President Joe Biden delivered the final State of the Union of his first term on Thursday, a speech packed with 2024 campaign themes and contrasts he plans to highlight in the eight months before Americans decide whether to give him — or Donald Trump — four more years in the White House.
title: Six key takeaways from Biden's final State of the Union before the 2024 election

description: Joe Biden dispensed with the pretense of rising above the political fray tonight, delivering a State of the Union address that hammered Donald Trump with unusual force.
title: Biden turns the State of the Union into a fiery campaign stump speech: From the Politics Desk

description: James Crumbley, the father of Michigan school shooter Ethan Crumbley, has had his jail phone rights limited “due to threatening statements,” officials said.
title: James Crumbley has jail communication privileges restricted after 'threatening statements'

description: In an unscripted moment during his State of the Union speech, President Joe Biden warned the Supreme Court justices not to underestimate the power of women.
title: Biden admonishes the Supreme Court for overturning Roe v. Wade

description: During his State of the Union address, Biden said that the working people who built this country pay more into Social Security than millionaires and billionaires, and says "it's not fair." He vows to make the wealthy "pay their fair share."
title: Biden vows to protect Social Security and make the wealthy 'pay their fair share'

description: U.S. spy agencies plan to provide briefings to Donald Trump if he secures the GOP nomination— despite concerns about how he has handled classified information
title: Trump to get intelligence briefings despite classified documents criminal trial

description: U.S. District Judge Lewis Kaplan said Trump has had plenty of time to arrange for payment since a jury rendered its $83.3 million verdict in January.
title: Judge denies Trump's request for more time to pay damages in Carroll defamation case

description: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon will hear arguments on two of Donald Trump’s motions to dismiss the classified documents case against him in Florida, according to a new order issued Thursday.
title: Judge in classified documents case will hear Trump motions to dismiss next week

description: Iditarod officials imposed a two-hour time penalty on musher Dallas Seavey for not properly gutting the moose he killed during the race earlier this week.
title: Iditarod musher who gutted moose during race didn't do so properly, judges say in handing down time penalty

description: Watch live coverage as President Biden delivers his 2024 State of the Union address to Congress.
title: President Biden delivers 2024 State of the Union address

description: A tire flew off a United Airlines Boeing plane shortly after taking off from San Francisco on Thursday, prompting an emergency landing in Los Angeles.
title: Tire flies off United Boeing plane shortly after takeoff
